meanings.definition: Able to be perceived or recognized.
meanings.sent1: The sound of the bell was discernible from far away.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's handwriting on the board was discernible to all the students.
meanings.sent3: The discernible smell of freshly baked cookies filled the entire house.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet forest, the discernible rustling of leaves hinted at hidden creatures.
meanings.sent5: The discernible taste of salt in the soup made it irresistible.

meanings.sent1: The bright red car was discernible among the sea of white vehicles.
meanings.sent2: Her unique laugh was always discernible in a crowded room.
meanings.sent3: The discernible pattern on his shirt made him easy to spot in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The discernible difference in texture between the two fabrics surprised her.
meanings.sent5: The discernible sparkle in her eyes revealed her excitement.

meanings.sent1: The instructions were written in a discernible manner for all to follow.
meanings.sent2: His explanation made the complex topic discernible to even the youngest students.
meanings.sent3: The discernible logic behind her decision impressed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The discernible path through the maze led them to the treasure.
meanings.sent5: The discernible joy in her voice brightened up the room.
